question: The Government of India (GoI) has launched UTTAM App for coal quality monitoring. What does "UTTAM" stands for?
option1: Unlocking Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal
option2: Underact Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal
option3: Underplay Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal
option4: Underboss Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal
answer: Unlocking Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal
explanation: Piyush Goyal, the Union Minister for Railways and Coal, has launched UTTAM App for Coal Quality Monitoring. UTTAM stands for â€“ Unlocking Transparency by Third Party Assessment of Mined Coal (uttam.coalindia.in). The app is developed by the Ministry of Coal and Coal India Limited (CIL). The purpose of the app is to provide an app for all citizens and coal consumers to monitor the process of Third Party Sampling of coal across CIL subsidiaries. UTTAM App ensures accountability, transparency, effectiveness and efficiency in coal ecosystem. It provides a platform for monitoring of sampling and coal dispatches. The App is designed with an aim to make the citizens a stakeholder in the coal ecosystem. UTTAM is an example of leveraging technology to facilitate a bidirectional channel between Coal India Limited and a common citizen. It ensures transparency and efficiency in the coal quality monitoring process and brings coal governance closer to people.
